headline.main: German Leader Calls Vote of Confidence on Role in Afghanistan

lead_paragraph: Putting severe pressure on his junior coalition partner, the Greens, Chancellor Gerhard Schröder today called a parliamentary vote of confidence over his decision to deploy up to 3,900 troops to support the war in Afghanistan. The vote, called for Friday, could result in a new ruling coalition in Germany or even new elections, a year before they are scheduled. Whatever happens, the politically adroit Mr. Schröder is likely to remain chancellor.
abstract: German Chancellor Gerhard Schroder, putting severe pressure on his junior coalition partner, Green party, calls parliamentary vote of confidence over his decision to deploy up to 3,900 troops to support war in Afghanistan; vote could result in new ruling coalition or even new elections (M)
